Hi all,
Just about to embark laying a floor all painted fine then a layer of noise killer
ref next layer of marine ply is 6mm thick enough? (the tiles being glued to that are only millimetres thick-a herringbone pattern)
also i cant buy marine ply large enough to to the rear in one hit, do you think tiles glued onto 2x seperate pieces will not move?
any other pitfalls to look out for or hints and tips greatly appreciated
Gary

Personally I used 12mm Medex (external MDF) It's marvellous stuff - really dense and not affected by moisture. Most sheet materials are available in larger format than 8X4 but if you attempt to fit the floor in one piece it will be a pig of a task to try and get it in, so I reckon you are better off sticking with the 'two-piece' design. All just my opinion of course.

I would say go down the 12mm marine ply route but if you are putting on tiles then use 10mm.
After the tiles are put on this will take the thickness to about 12mm and you can then use 12mm aliminium right angle to cover the edge that shows.
Jason
